articleContent.intro: Variables store data for processing in a program. They are fundamental building blocks in all programming languages.

sections.heading: Understanding Variables
sections.content: Variables are containers for storing data values. The syntax depends on the language but follows general conventions.
notes: Used in every program
Essential for logic and memory

sections.heading: Variable Scope and Shadowing
sections.content: Scopes define the visibility of variables. Shadowing occurs when a variable in a local scope has the same name as one in an outer scope.
notes: Understand scope to avoid logical errors

sections.heading: Memory Management and Variables
sections.content: Advanced variable usage includes references and memory cleanup.
notes: Java uses automatic garbage collection
